DOC.brief_summary: To assess pelvic floor symptoms and quality of life in elderly women.
DOC.brief_title: Pelvic Floor Symptoms and Quality of Life in Elderly Women - a Population-based Pilot Study
DOC.detailed_description: The aim is to assess pelvic floor symptoms and quality of life in elderly women. The study is conducted as population-based in 100-130 women at the age of 64-66 years. All study objects are examined gynecologically and with vaginal ultrasound. Subjective symptoms are evaluated with validated questionnaires concerning pelvic floor symptoms, sexual symptoms and quality of life. This is a pilot study before a larger scale population-based study.
DOC.criteria: All women in one municipality aged 6466 years who are willing to participate in the study. Persons under guardianship or who does not understand the used questionnaires.
